intro: Endopogon vitellinus, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Endopogon vitellinus is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
